channel.title: Noobs asking how to run moparscape
channel.description:
I've noticed that noobs are getting a little out of hand asking questions about moparscape. I looked in the moparscape questions today to see if there were any questions I could answer, and I got tons of threads that said "OMG I CANT GET MOPARSCAPE TO WORK PLS HELP!!!11111"
Also, 95% of all of those people are unactive. They expect to just sit and leech away, and when they have a problem, they expect everyone to drop whatever they're doing and help them. It pisses me off to see some guy ask a question and then disappear. They don't ever come to post anything useful, just their gay questions. And when they get the answer, they never post until they encounter another problem.
Also, it's not too hard to use the search button or look at the stickies on the top of the page. I think that a good solution to the problem would be to put a couple mods and assign them the question and moparscape question topics. Post what you think should be done to get rid of those annoying threads.

item.title: Noobs asking how to run moparscape
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

we dont hate noobs whothe0. we just hate leeching noobs, the ones that ask for everything and never rep you for helping them or contribute to the community or never even a simple thankyou. now thats the ones i hate

Read full topic

gosh every1 shutup! paulT i can say by far ur the most annoying person ive ever met we wouldnt have to hate noobs if we took the time to help them! :P:P:P

item.title: Noobs asking how to run moparscape

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:7, topic:6351”]Drag em to the trashcan… lol
we need a huge noob-proof FAQ that opens when you try to open the board :)[/quote]

I was about to get all the info, errors and answers to write a FAQ and post it in both moparscape questions and normal questions.

Read full topic

item.title: Noobs asking how to run moparscape
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

what I decided to do to get rid of them is make that Moparscape questions catagory, at least now they dont post the same questions in EVERY board, now I can periodically delete all of those topics with a few clicks if I want

If anyone else has suggestions on other ways to stop it, please please tell me.

Read full topic
